content.question: An Atwood’s machine is set up by suspending two blocks connected by a string of negligible mass over a pulley, as shown above. The blocks are initially held at rest and then released at time <math alttext="t sub 0, equals 0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>s</mi></mstyle></mrow></math>. The speed of the <math alttext="3 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mtext> </mtext><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> block at time <math alttext="t sub 1, equals 2.0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mn>2.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>s</mi></mstyle></mrow></math> is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
